page.title: International reactions to the 2011 Egyptian revolution

rev.diff:
Line 22: Line 22:
}}</ref> On 6 February, protesters in Cairo's Tahrir Square accused Iran of interfering in Egyptian affairs.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/311143 |title=Thousands flock to Tahrir to honor protests' martyrs | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date= |accessdate=8 February 2011}}</ref>
}}</ref> On 6 February, protesters in Cairo's Tahrir Square accused Iran of interfering in Egyptian affairs.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/311143 |title=Thousands flock to Tahrir to honor protests' martyrs | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date= |accessdate=8 February 2011}}</ref>
*: [[Foreign Affairs Minister of Iran|Iranian Foreign Minister]] [[Ali Akbar Salehi]] hoped that the Egyptians' "high aims, national demands and resurrection of their glory could be achieved in the very near future." [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Iran)|Iranian Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] spokesman [[Ramin Mehmanparast]] called on Egypt to "abide by the rightful demands of the nation."<ref>{{cite news |author=[[Staff writer]]|title=Egypt Protests Draw Mixed Reaction in Region|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/meast/01/29/egypt.middle.east.reaction/|work=[[CNN]]|date=29 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> There were "solidarity" protests outside the Egyptian interests section.{{clarify|date=January 2011}}<!--which embassy?-->
*: [[Foreign Affairs Minister of Iran|Iranian Foreign Minister]] [[Ali Akbar Salehi]] hoped that the Egyptians' "high aims, national demands and resurrection of their glory could be achieved in the very near future." [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Iran)|Iranian Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] spokesman [[Ramin Mehmanparast]] called on Egypt to "abide by the rightful demands of the nation."<ref>{{cite news |author=[[Staff writer]]|title=Egypt Protests Draw Mixed Reaction in Region|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/meast/01/29/egypt.middle.east.reaction/|work=[[CNN]]|date=29 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> There were "solidarity" protests outside the Egyptian interests section.{{clarify|date=January 2011}}<!--which embassy?-->
â
*: [[Islamic Consultative Assembly (Iran)|Iranian parliament speaker]] [[Ali Larijani]] said, "The voice of the brave people of Egypt is the voice of revolution. The start of this revolution has astonished the despotic regimes of the region. The parliament supports the uprising of the Tunisian and Egyptian people." He described the protests as "the revolution of the noble."<ref>{{cite web|author=Name * |url=http://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2011/01/iran-backs-egypts-revolution-of-the-noble/ |title=Iran backs Egypt's 'revolution of the noble' | Pakistan Today | Latest news, Breaking news, Pakistan News, World news, business, sport and multimedia |publisher=Pakistan Today |date=2011-01-30 |accessdate=2011-04-27}}</ref> Iran backed the protests. Parliament speaker [[Ali Larijani]] called the uprising the "revolution of the noble". He compared Western reaction to the protests with their reaction to the 1979 [[Islamic Revolution]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Name * |url=http://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2011/01/iran-backs-egypts-revolution-of-the-noble/ |title=Iran backs Egypt's 'revolution of the noble' | Pakistan Today | Latest news, Breaking news, Pakistan News, World news, business, sport and multimedia |publisher=Pakistan Today |date=2011-01-30 |accessdate=2011-04-27}}</ref>
+
*: [[Islamic Consultative Assembly (Iran)|Iranian parliament speaker]] [[Ali Larijani]] said, "The voice of the brave people of Egypt is the voice of revolution. The start of this revolution has astonished the despotic regimes of the region. The parliament supports the uprising of the Tunisian and Egyptian people." He described the protests as "the revolution of the noble."<ref name="pakistantoday1">{{cite web|author=Name * |url=http://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2011/01/iran-backs-egypts-revolution-of-the-noble/ |title=Iran backs Egypt's 'revolution of the noble' | Pakistan Today | Latest news, Breaking news, Pakistan News, World news, business, sport and multimedia |publisher=Pakistan Today |date=2011-01-30 |accessdate=2011-04-27}}</ref> Iran backed the protests. Parliament speaker [[Ali Larijani]] called the uprising the "revolution of the noble". He compared Western reaction to the protests with their reaction to the 1979 [[Islamic Revolution]].<ref name="pakistantoday1"/>
** [[Mir Hossein Mousavi]] and [[Mehdi Karroubi]], former presidential candidates and the leaders of the [[Iranian Green Movement|Green Movement]], released a statement from their virtual [[house arrest]] in Tehran, assuring the Egyptians, "No power can suppress the people's will and demand. Sooner or later, autocratic and tyrant power[s] are sentenced to vanish."<ref name="Khamenei"/>
** [[Mir Hossein Mousavi]] and [[Mehdi Karroubi]], former presidential candidates and the leaders of the [[Iranian Green Movement|Green Movement]], released a statement from their virtual [[house arrest]] in Tehran, assuring the Egyptians, "No power can suppress the people's will and demand. Sooner or later, autocratic and tyrant power[s] are sentenced to vanish."<ref name="Khamenei"/>
* {{flag|Iraq}} â Prime Minister [[Nouri al-Maliki]] stated, "The people have the right to express what they want without being persecuted... One of the characteristics of a lack of democracy is when a leader rules for 30 or 40 years. It is a difficult issue for people, it is intolerable and change is necessary."<ref>{{cite news

[[File:NYC Rally for Egyptian Democracy Protestors, 29 January 2011 008.jpg|thumb|Solidarity protest in [[New York City]], 29 January]]
â
The Egyptian embassy in Venezuela was temporarily taken over by Venezuelans of Egyptian descent,<ref>{{cite news|author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://online.wsj.com/article/BT-CO-20110128-715552.html|publisher=''[[Dow Jones]]'' (via ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'')|title=Egypt Embassy In Venezuela Sees Shortlived Protest â Chavez|date=28 January 2011|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> an action which was condemned by President [[Hugo Chavez]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Mardones, Carolina |url=http://www.panorama.com.ve/29-01-2011/avances/embajada-caracas.html/ |title=Manifestantes toman temporalmente embajada de Egipto en Caracas|translation=Protesters temporarily take Egyptian Embassy in Caracas |language=[[Spanish language|Spanish]]|work=panorama.com.ve |date=28 January 2011 |accessdate=3 February 2011}}</ref>
+
The Egyptian embassy in Venezuela was temporarily taken over by Venezuelans of Egyptian descent,<ref>{{cite news|author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://online.wsj.com/article/BT-CO-20110128-715552.html|publisher=''[[Dow Jones]]'' (via ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'')|title=Egypt Embassy In Venezuela Sees Shortlived Protest â Chavez|date=28 January 2011|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> an action which was condemned by President [[Hugo Chavez]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Mardones, Carolina |url=http://www.panorama.com.ve/29-01-2011/avances/embajada-caracas.html |title=Manifestantes toman temporalmente embajada de Egipto en Caracas|translation=Protesters temporarily take Egyptian Embassy in Caracas |language=[[Spanish language|Spanish]]|work=panorama.com.ve |date=28 January 2011 |accessdate=3 February 2011}}</ref>
Egyptians in Ireland and members of the [[Irish Anti-War Movement]] held a protest outside the embassy in Dublin on 28 January to "show solidarity for the people in Egypt to say to them that we are behind you and we support you."<ref>Bray, Allison (29 January 2011). [http://www.independent.ie/world-news/africa/protesters-demand-justice-and-democracy-at-embassy-demo-2516024.html "Protesters Demand Justice and Democracy at Embassy Demo"]. ''[[Irish Independent]]''. Retrieved 31 January 2011.</ref>
